metadata.title: CVE-2024-25744 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.6.7, an untrusted VMM can trigger int80syscall handling at any given point. This is related toarch/x86/coco/tdx/tdx.c and arch/x86/mm/mem_encrypt_amd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-25744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-125-generic - 5.15.0-125.135
linux-image-5.15.0-125-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-125.135
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-125-generic - 5.15.0-125.135
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-125-generic-64k - 5.15.0-125.135
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-25-generic - 6.5.0-25.25~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-25-generic - 6.5.0-25.25~22.04.1

No subscription required
